name: places/ChIJd7rp-lZYwokRU37N6wdTz-c
formattedAddress: 370 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 370 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I made reservations for a Honda Civic. Upon my arrival I find the car to be filthy, reeking of marijuana and cigarettes smell, blunt filling on the floor of the car in the backseat, dirty seats and burn hole on the chairs, furthermore there was a spare tire on the car and the rim was bent. I was able to get into a different car after calling customer services with the concern. I was charged twice for the reservation on my debt card in error. I give them a 3 star rating because when I called customer service they were kind and attentive. They refunded the extra charge that was made in error. I also canceled my membership with them.

originalText.text:
3rd time in 2 months ZipCar messed up our plans. Two times a reservation disappeared in their system with no notice or explanation other than the rep saying their software was upgrades. They don't know their own inventory - one time I found a car they did not suggest online. They  have limited inventory - can't find a replacement nearby in Manhattan.

In the past, they've had issues and it's messed up plans several times as if there's an issue, they basically don't have a good solution. They will offer to pay for an Uber to take you somewhere inconvenient to pick up a car. How about having a staff member who can go get the car and bring it to your location on time? One time, the car I got was blocked in at the garage, and the guys there couldn't access it. This was to go to a friend's funeral. I had to rent a car at the last minute from another vendor - who had inventory unlike ZipCar.

They also have failed several times to follow up on customer service actions  e.g. I've requested call-backs from them after "escalation" and no one has ever responded.

Most recently spoke with Ivan employee ID 2420168 and requested a call-back within 30 minutes. No response.

originalText.text: Customer service has cratered in New York City since Avis acquired Zipcar. Phone agents seem afraid to speak candidly, After years of renting Zipcars without any issues I was recently charged  for keeping a car 2 hours past the reservation period. This was not the case and I complained by email. The next time I rented the car for the same period and returned it on time, I called a customer service rep and said I was having trouble with my key card and asked if she could confirm that they recognized it had been returned. She did so confirm and told me they were able to use gps to find where the car was located. I received an irritatingly condescending email of the variety typical of the most hated consumer service corporations in the U.S to the effect that they would overlook my failure this time and return the penalty charge,  Any admission of error is anathema to these companies.

originalText.text: I picked up a car that was dirty, didn't have the required amount of gas, and then became locked out of the car because the key cart technology stopped working, leaving me stranded in the cold and dark for over three hours without resolution.  When they finally sent a tow truck, it was in SAN FRANCISCO.  I'M IN NEW YORK.  I had to beg and tell them I was concerned for my safety when they did relent and let me leave the car to find another way to get home, three hours away.  I've received conflicting information EVERY TIME I called customer service about the status of helping my situation.  To make matters worse, my wallet was locked in the car.  It is now TWO DAYS later, and I am still struggling to get my property back.  One of their reps told me it was not ZipCar's responsibility that my wallet was locked in their car and there is nothing they can do.  UPDATE--now it is Tuesday, I was told my wallet would be delivered by the tow truck driver (didn't happen), via UPS overnight to receive Saturday (didn't happen), and then a manager yesterday was going to hand deliver it to me in the evening (didn't happen).  UTTER FAILURE.  STILL WAITING.

UTTER FAILURE.  STILL WAITING.

originalText.text:
I’ve used Zipcar for 6 years in NYC. Don’t bother unless you like to drive in cars that are not mechanically maintained, inconvenient and enjoy a frustrating & unsatisfactory customer service experience.
I started using Zipcar because it was a convenient & effortless car sharing service. It used to be a great company until AVIS acquired them in 2013. The servicing of the vehicles has declined rapidly since that acquisition.
I’ve called into Zipcar to report services problem when I've picked up a car and then when reserving that car a week or two later had the same issue. Not small issues, major, like the passenger seat is unmovable and up close to the dash board which made it impossible to use since we were 5 travelers. There has been animal hair allover the seats that covered our clothing on the way to a wedding ( animals are required to be in carriers). We’ve experienced seat belts that were not working, service lights on dashboard that were still there a month later.
There are lots of Zipcars and lots of Zipcar drivers in NYC so to get another Zipcar at the last minute is impossible if there’s something wrong with it.  I understand that there will be issues occasionally …but this has become a REGULARLY occurrence. I now call in to ask if the car I’ll be using has any service reports before I use it. I thought this would help but it turns out that the majority of Zipsters can’t be bothered to call in service issues or is it that Customer Service has a policy to not let drivers know that there was an issue reported? Regardless or which it is, this has not work since I have very often this past year gotten to a car that cannot be started, has a broken something or other, service lights on or is filthy, really filthy…food scraps, stained seats and on occasion cigarette ashes ( smoking is prohibited).
I have this past month ( Feb 2019) called them 5 times to get answer to a question and was told that they would respond within 48 hours…the first response came as a form email after 10 days and 2 additional calls to them. The second response has not come but it is now 12 days & 2 calls since I called. Is it time to buy a car? I think so.
The idea of car sharing is convenience, Zipcar is an inconvenient & frustrating service.
